name: The Way, the Truth, and the Life Quiz | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: "He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at ..." About whom did Jesus make this statement in John 8:7 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Adulterous woman.

	When an adulterous woman was caught in the act of adultery, the Scribes and Pharisees brought her before Jesus. After Jesus made this comment, everyone left Jesus and the woman alone. Jesus told the adulterous woman to leave and not to sin anymore.

questions.text: Where was Jesus when he said "I and my Father are one" in John 10:30 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Solomon's porch.

	Jesus was on Solomon's porch at a dedication ceremony in Jerusalem when he made this comment. The Jews wanted Jesus to tell them if He was the Christ. When Jesus made this comment, the Jews picked up stones to stone Him.

questions.text: "The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified." What was Jesus speaking of when he made this remark in John 12:23 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
His death and ascension.

	Jesus said this after Andrew and Phillip told Him that the people were wanting to see Him while He was in Jerusalem. By saying this, Jesus was speaking of His death and ascension into Heaven

questions.text: Which one of the disciples was Jesus speaking to in John 14:6 (KJV) when he said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life."?
questions.explanation:
Thomas.

	Thomas was unsure of where Jesus was going and how the disciples could get there to be with Him. Jesus was saying that without knowing Him no one can know the way to Heaven, without learning the truth of His word no one can get to Heaven, and without believing in Him no one will live eternally in Heaven.

questions.text: "It is I, be not afraid." Who did Jesus calm with these words in John 6:20 (KJV)?
options: Little children who came to Him
Mary, his mother, at the cross
questions.explanation:
Disciples during a storm.

	The disciples were in a ship headed to Capernaum when a storm hit three to four miles from land. Jesus reassured the disciples with those words when He walked out on the water to meet the ship.

questions.text: When Jesus washed the feet of the disciples, who was He speaking of when He stated in John 13:11 (KJV), "Ye are not all clean."?
questions.explanation:
Judas.

	Jesus knew that Judas Iscariot was going to betray Him and soon, but the other disciples didn't know to whom He was speaking. Jesus was washing the disciples' feet before the feast of the Passover.

questions.text: "Gather up the fragments that remain that nothing be lost." What was Jesus speaking of when he told the disciples to do this in John 6:12 (KJV)?
questions.correct: Remnants from five loaves of bread
questions.explanation:
Remnants from five loaves of bread.

	Jesus was speaking of the remnants of the five loaves of bread that were distributed among the crowd that came to hear Jesus speak. Of the five loaves and two fishes that were distributed among the crowd, twelve baskets of leftover bread were gathered from the five loaves.

questions.text: "Thou hast well said, I have no husband." Whom did Jesus speak these words to in John 4:17 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Samaritan woman.

	The Samaritan woman was at the well when Jesus asked for a drink. When Jesus asked about the woman's husband, the Samaritan woman told him she had no husband, but Jesus disagreed with her and told her she had several husbands.

questions.text: "Many good works have I shewed you from My Father, for which of these works do ye _____ Me?" Which of these punishments was Jesus going to be subjected to in John 10:32 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Stone.

	The Jews responded to Jesus' question by telling Him that they weren't going to stone Him for his good works but for blasphemy about being God. Jesus was able to get away and headed past Jordan to where his cousin John the Baptist was baptizing. He was there when he received word of Lazarus.

questions.text: "Ye shall seek Me, and ye shall not find Me: and where I am, thither ye cannot come." Who did Jesus say this to in John 7:34 (KJV)?
questions.explanation:
Jews.

	Jesus was at the Festival of Tabernacles. Halfway through the festival, Jesus went to the temple courts to speak to the people. It was here that the Jewish people began questioning Jesus. The Pharisees heard he was teaching and preaching in the temple courts and set out to arrest him. When Jesus made this comment, he was speaking of ascending into Heaven after his death. When the crowd broke up, Jesus went to the Mount of Olives while everyone else went home.
